Literature Review: The COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of epidemiological models in forecasting the trajectory of infectious disease outbreaks. These models have been widely used to inform public health policy responses and guide decision-making during the pandemic. In this review, we examine the main elements of epidemiological models used to forecast the spread of COVID-19 and discuss the contributions of economists to the discussion of public health policies.
